Body mass index, or BMI, is a measure of body size. It combines a person's weight with their height. The results of a BMI measurement can give an idea about whether a person has the correct weight for their height.

 Carrying too much weight can lead to a variety of health conditions, such as type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure, and cardiovascular problems.

 A weigh that is too low can increase the risk of malnutrition, osteoporosis, and anemia. The doctor will make suitable recommendations.

 BMI does not measure body fat directly, and it does not account for age, sex, ethnicity, or muscle mass in adults. However, it uses standard weight status categories that can help doctors to track weight status across populations and identify potential issues in individuals.
Your BMI result is perfect! Keep up your shape and enjoy life.
Your weight is too small… Please try eat regularly but remember to eat healthy food.
Your weight is a bit too high… Try to limit sweets and move more.
Your BMI is too high. You should go on a diet and start training some sports. Just jogging or swimming will be a good idea.
You definitely eat too much! Change your life rhythm radically and start practicing some sport and eating healthier. Consider visiting a dietitian for some pieces of advice.
